intro: Tanacetum vestitum, commonly known as the hairy tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces yellow button-like flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Tanacetum vestitum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
